TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Click on each apparatus/reagents to know its name or click on “Continue” to start the experiment.
Place a butter paper in the electronic balance and Tare.
1 g soil is weighed using electronic balance. Using a spatula transfer some soil into the butter paper.
Take the butter paper contain soil.
Transfer the soil into the 500 ml conical flask.
Measure 10 mL 1N K₂Cr₂O7 solution
Measure 10 mL 1N K₂Cr₂O7 solution.
Transfer the solution into the standard flask containing soil.
Transfer the solution into the standard flask containing soil.
Shake well to mix it well. And keep it back.
Then add 20 mL Con. H₂SO₄.
Transfer this Con. H₂SO₄ into the conical flask.
notext
Swirl the conical flask 2 or 3 times to mix it.
Allow the flask to stand for 30 minutes on an asbestos sheet for the reaction to complete.
Measure 200 mL distilled water.
Measure 200 mL distilled water.
Pour 200 mL of water to the flask to dilute the suspension.
Pour 200 mL of water to the flask to dilute the suspension.
notext
Allow the flask to stand for 30 minutes on an asbestos sheet for the reaction to complete.
Filter if it is expected that the end point of the titration is not to be clear.Filter the suspension using funnel.
Collect the filtrate in in a clean conical flask.
Collect the filtrate in in a clean conical flask.
notext
Pour the suspension through a glass rod.
notext
Collect the liquid.
Take the conical flask containing filtrate.
Take 10 mL of 85% H₃PO₄.
To the filtrate add 10 mL of 85% H₃PO₄.
notext
Add 2-3 drops of diphenylamine indicator.
Add 2-3 drops of diphenylamine indicator.
notext
Titrate using 0.5N Ferrous ammonium Sulphate: Take a clean burette.
Rinse and fill the burette using 0.5 N Ferrous Ammonium Sulphate.
Carefully fill the burette up to the mark.
Carefully fill the burette up to the mark.
notext
Clamp the burette in the stand.
Take the conical flask containing filtrate.
Place it below the burette.

Open the knob of the burette and add Ferrous Ammonium Sulphate drop by drop from the burette to the conical flask. At the end point the colour flashes from violet through blue to bright green. Note the burette reading as 16 ml.
notext
Take 1N K₂Cr₂O7 solution.
Measure 10 mL using a clean measuring jar.
notext
And transfer the solution in a clean conical flask.
notext
Take 20 mL Con. H₂SO₄.
And add this Con. H₂SO₄ into the conical flask.
notext
Swirl the conical flask 2 or 3 times to mix it.
Swirl the conical flask 2 or 3 times to mix it.
notext
Measure 200 mL distilled water.
Measure 200 mL distilled water.
Pour the water into the flask to dilute the suspension.
notext
Shake well.
Shake well.
Take 10 mL of 85% H₃PO₄.
Transfer this 85% H₃PO₄ into the conical flask.
notext
Add 2-3 drops of diphenylamine indicator.
Add 2-3 drops of diphenylamine indicator.
notext
Shake well.
Shake well and keep.
Take a clean burette.
Fill the burette using 0.5 N Ferrous Ammonium Sulphate.
Carefully fill the burette using 0.5 N Ferrous Ammonium Sulphate.
Adjust the burette reading up to the mark.
Adjust the burette reading up to the mark.
Clamp the burette in the stand.
Take the conical flask containing filtrate.
Place it below the burette.

Open the knob of the burette and add Ferrous Ammonium Sulphate drop by drop from the burette to the conical flask. At the end point the colour flashes from violet through blue to bright green. Note the burette reading as 19.8 ml.
notext
